data.title: Spaghetti Western: Spaghetti Western, Also Known As Italian Western or Macaroni Western (Primarily in Japan)
data.meta_description:
Spaghetti Western - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The document provides an overview of Spaghetti Westerns, a subgenre of Western films that emerged in the mid-1960s in Italy. Key points include:
- They were produced and directed mostly by Italians on low budgets, and filmed in Italy and Spain, with multilingual casts. 
- Sergio Leone's "A Fistful of Dollars" (1964) established the style, borrowing the plot from Kurosawa's "Yojimbo". 
- Ennio Morricone's scores were also influential. Over 600 were made between 1960-1978, many imitating Leone's films.
- They eschewed some conventions of traditional American Westerns and
data.text: Spaghetti Western: Spaghetti Western, Also Known As Italian Western or Macaroni Western (Primarily in Japan)
